greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q^(-17/24) * (eta(q) * eta(q^6)^4) / (eta(q^2) * eta(q^3)^2) in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) := Product_{k>=1} (1-(-q)^k) (see A121373), phi(q) := theta_3(q) := Sum_{k=-oo..oo} q^(k^2) (A000122), psi(q) := Sum_{k=0..oo} q^(k*(k+1)/2) (A010054), chi(q) := Product_{k>=0} (1+q^(2k+1)) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of psi(q^3)^2 * chi(-q) in powers of q where psi(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
mathematica: eta[q_] := q^(1/24)*QPochhammer[q]; CoefficientList[Series[q^(-17/24)*(eta[q]*eta[q^6]^4)/(eta[q^2]*eta[q^3]^2), {q, 0, 100}], q] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 18 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) * eta(x^6 + A)^4 / eta(x^2 + A) / eta(x^3 + A)^2, n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, May 10 2005
